slides.title: Testing ARIA
slides.content:
# Testing ARIA üß™

Verify your ARIA implementation.

## Browser DevTools:
- Chrome: Accessibility pane
- Firefox: Accessibility Inspector
- View accessibility tree

## Screen Reader Testing:
1. Turn on screen reader
2. Navigate with keyboard
3. Verify announcements
4. Check focus order

## Common Tests:
```
[ ] Roles announced correctly
[ ] Labels read properly
[ ] States update announced
[ ] Live regions working
[ ] Focus management correct
```

## Tools:
- axe DevTools extension
- NVDA Screen Reader
- VoiceOver (Mac)
- Chrome Accessibility Inspector

## Checklist:
- All custom widgets have roles
- Interactive elements labeled
- States reflect UI state
- Live regions for dynamic content

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Congratulations! üéâ

You've mastered ARIA Attributes!

## Key Takeaways:

### Roles - What it IS
- Landmark roles for structure
- Widget roles for custom components

### Labels - What it's CALLED
- aria-label for direct naming
- aria-labelledby for references
- aria-describedby for hints

### States - What it DOES
- aria-expanded, aria-selected
- aria-checked, aria-pressed
- aria-hidden, aria-disabled

### Properties - How it RELATES
- aria-controls, aria-owns
- aria-live for dynamic content

## Remember:
| Rule | Guidance |
|------|----------|
| First | Use native HTML |
| Second | Add keyboard support |
| Third | Test with screen readers |

## Next Steps:
- Learn SEO basics
- Master semantic HTML
- Build accessible components

Make the web accessible! ‚ôø
